resources.string: The app has been updated with convo information for 2013–2014 academic year.

While we strive to provide correct information about convocations, the data may be flawed or out of date due to changes by Berea College. If you are a student, by using this app you acknowledge that as you are solely responsible for keeping track of your convocations and convo cards MUST still be turned in.
If you have found this app useful, please rate it and leave a comment in the Play Store. Thank you!

"This app was developed by Jacob Patton, and was originally started by Jacob Patton and Abraham Kali as part of the Advanced Android App class at Berea College. It is an open source app licensed under the Apache License Version 2.0. If you would enjoy creating such projects, consider taking a computer science class or even majoring or minoring in computer science"

Viewing Convos
To view a certain convocation simply click on the title of the convo. This will either open it in a new window or in the display panel.

Sorting Convos
To toggle between Fall and Spring convocations, click the button in the top right corner. If you would like to sort the convocations by time, either slide your finger to the right, or click the top left button to show the menu.

Attendance
To mark a convocation as attended, long press on the list title until a green arrow appears. This does NOT mark it as attended in the Berea College database. It is simply a way to help you keep track of how many you have attended. You still are required to turn in your convocation card.
